intro: Cacalia exilis, commonly known as the slender cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Cacalia exilis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
